title: Drawing, "Summer, Lunette for Ceiling, Sala Ottagonale, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1804–05
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and light brown wash over graphite on white laid paper
inscribed: Recto: inscribed in graphite, upper center: estate; in graphite: squared off at sides 1-4 and top and bottom 1-8 with light source symbol at upper right. Verso: in pen and brown ink, left center: cosi.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Winged putto holding sheaves of grain and sickle.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Summer, Lunette for Ceiling, Sala Ottagonale, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1804–05.
1804–05. Pen and brown ink, brush and light brown wash over graphite on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1183.
